content: In connection with recent events, I propose to hold a vote and determine the fate of the bitcointalk forumFirst way. Going offshore like PirateBay (offshore hosting). comments.author: Jet Cash
comments.body: Surely it's best to have a forum where topics can be discussed openly and without suppression. Fraud and theft is everywhere on the net, so we need somewhere to alert people to scams, and for the authorities to use the information to trace and punish the perpetrators. I thought the US gov had started a couple of mixers to attract scammers and money launderers - It seems to be an easy way to net the unwary. Just another thought, do any of the mega Bitcoin whales use this forum? I mean the guys that transfer thousands of Bitcoin at a time. It would be nice if we could get some opinions from them. I bet they read the forum, or at least get reports on significant posts.Like it or not, they are influencing the future of Bitcoin, and we need to learn how to cope in a changing world. Many projects of the grey initiative ( some people call it the green initiative ) are failing. EVs and medical injections are two examples. CBDCs are on the way, and we need to learn how Bitcoin will co-exist with them.Â  Maybe now is the time to have a CBDC board so that we can protect our interests, and possibly influence government policy. I believe that we need to preserve fiat, gold and Bitcoin, and introduce CBDCs as an alternative government controoled currency, and we need an efficient means of conversion between the four media. That's wishful thinking, as there is too much fiat debt for the banks to preserve it in its present form.
